article_title: Chronicle reporter Deam announced as Loeb finalist
article_text:
Chronicle reporter Deam announced as Loeb finalist

Photo: Michael Ciaglo, Staff Val Holeman sorts through a drawer of drugs for her 10-year-old...

Chronicle business reporter Jenny Deam, author of a series of articles last year that penetrated the medical/insurance bureaucracy to explain how changes related to the Affordable Care Act are affecting ordinary Americans, was named Thursday as a finalist in the prestigious Gerald Loeb Awards.

article_metadata.description: Chronicle business reporter Jenny Deam, author of a series of articles last year that penetrated the medical/insurance bureaucracy to explain how changes related to the Affordable Care Act are affecting ordinary Americans, was named Thursday as a finalist in the prestigious Gerald Loeb Awards.  The reporting found insurers denying coverage by other means, such as a "medical necessity" loophole that cuts treatment for mentally ill people who likewise were promised increased access by the federal reforms.
article_metadata.author.name: HOUSTON CHRONICLE
